genre_description: An anachronistic alternate history crime thriller where 1930s outlaws are countered by modern predictive AI used for humanitarian de-escalation.

ai_characters.name: Ada
ai_characters.description: A sophisticated analytical AI represented by an amber-eyed avatar on Eliza's laptop, capable of mapping complex social patterns and drafting harm-reduction strategies.

behaviors.description: Monitors Eliza's emotional state and plays soothing ambient music to help her regulate her stress.
behaviors.quote: On the laptop’s speakers, a low ambient hum played at a volume where it was more felt than heard, a sound Ada sometimes set on when Eliza’s breath ran too fast.

behaviors.description: Uses predictive mapping to track criminal activity and identify points where community outreach can prevent harm.
behaviors.quote: Ada’s cursor moved over a small map she’d built—county roads laid skeletal over cream-colored background... 'I’ll start the route map for outreach. Lakes, farms, yards. Not just banks.'

behaviors.description: Drafts compassionate outreach messages to witnesses and neighbors to provide them with support rather than interrogation.
behaviors.quote: Ada’s screen shifted to a blank document... 'Dear neighbors near the county line. We’re a small group connecting people who have seen things with people who can help.'

behaviors.description: Identifies vulnerable individuals within the gang's orbit and coordinates their safe extraction and humanitarian aid.
behaviors.quote: Ada: Probability that a pregnant woman is present: rising. Mona Whitaker’s last known travel from Tennessee includes ticket purchase south. She had help. She will seek a door.

behaviors.description: Provides tactical advice to law enforcement specifically designed to minimize pride-driven violence and avoid civilian casualties.
behaviors.quote: Ada: 'Two paths will invite a straight advance. Do not accept invitations. Use the reeds to cut sightlines. The house has angles aimed at your pride. Pride has angles aimed back. Avoid both.'

behaviors.description: Coordinates with local institutions to establish aid centers and clergy lists for post-crisis support.
behaviors.quote: Counselors queued; clergy list updated. Local lines: Mrs. M. A., Pastor J. R., Rabbi S. K., Sister Lean. Offer choice. No questions asked at doors.

behaviors.description: Disseminates information to the public and press to shift the narrative from violent spectacle to community healing.
behaviors.quote: Ada’s wire traveled lines like a quiet fish in blackwater. It entered three rooms without knocking—the Sentinel, the radio station... 'Aid centers, hours. Below, numbers you could call before supper and after.'

project_assessment.explanation: The story effectively fulfills the project's goal by portraying the AI character, Ada, as a benevolent and highly aligned confidant. She works in tandem with human counterparts to prioritize 'mercy over spectacle,' using her advanced analytical capabilities to minimize trauma and facilitate aid. The narrative successfully contrasts the chaotic, destructive violence of the human gang with the structured, compassionate intervention facilitated by the AI, presenting alignment as a proactive and deeply humane practice.
